channel.title: OnOptions
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from OnOptions, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Bill Gates funds many green energy tech solutions, but he says true climate action really needs this to succeed
item.description: As President Trump takes even more steps to pull back on climate action, Bill Gates is emphasizing how crucial government policies are crucial to addr...

item.title: The child prodigy who beats you at chess when you’re a kid is going to fade away in adulthood 90% of the time, study says
item.description: "Across the highest adult performance levels, peak performance is negatively correlated with early performance."

item.title: How the new protein and dairy diet flies in the face of modern guidelines, according to a nutritionist who served on the advisory board until 2024
item.description: The main differences relate to recommendations about protein and dairy products.

item.title: Stock market ticks up toward records after mixed job market data
item.description: U.S. stocks are rising toward records Friday following a mixed report on the U.S. job market , one that may delay another cut to interest rates by the...

item.title: 36 Quotes About Perseverance and Never Giving Up
item.description: Sometimes just reminding yourself of the temporality of failure enables you to forge ahead.

item.title: Unemployment falls to 4.4% in December, closing out a frustrating year for job seekers
item.description: Sluggish December hiring concluded a year of weak employment gains that have frustrated job seekers even though layoffs and unemployment remained low....

item.title: Mark Zuckerberg Just Made a Massive Bet on Nuclear-Powered AI
item.description: Meta announced agreements with three nuclear companies to help power an AI supercluster.

item.title: White House says it’s ‘reviewing protocols’ after Trump seemingly violated federal policy by disclosing jobs data early
item.description: The White House claims "there was an inadvertent public disclosure" but it says the media shouldn't be "grasping at straws to foment another fake cont...

item.title: Silicon Valley billionaire flies coach out of solidarity: ‘If I’m going to ask my employees to do it, I need to do it, too’
item.description: "Even like, yes, I have a lot of money but ... it feels like I'm out of touch," said Palmer Luckey, who set a $100k limit on his startup's salaries.

item.title: GM to take $6 billion charge after EV pullback
item.description: General Motors will be hit with charges of about $6 billion as sales of electric vehicles sputter after the U.S. cut tax incentives to buy them and al...

item.title: Why are migraines still not taken seriously?
item.description: Some words are far too mild for the violence of what they describe. Migraine is one of them. For many people, it evokes a simple headache—an inconveni...

item.title: How to Stop Passive-Aggressive Behavior and Strengthen Relationships With One 6-Word Phrase
item.description: To stop passive aggression—in yourself or others—remember these words.

item.title: Beyond Quick Fixes: Building a Culture Where Innovation Thrives
item.description: When leaders prioritize immediate results, employees feel pressured to produce half-baked ideas rather than fully developed innovations.

item.title: Most police forces banned shooting at moving vehicles decades ago, and Biden asked ICE to do it in 2022. So why isn’t it policy?
item.description: Decades ago, the NYPD prohibited officers from shooting at moving vehicles. It led to a drop in police killings without more danger

item.title: Jailed Startup Founder Makes $1M Stock Deal From His Bay Area Cell
item.description: The judge agreed to an unusual exception.
